com.milk.uberchat.iface
Interface ChatEntity

All Superinterfaces:
Commandable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ChatChannel, ChatChannelHolder, ChatIdentity, ChatLocus, ChatSystem, ChatUser
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseChannel, BaseChannelHolder, BaseEntity, BaseIdentity, BaseLocus, BaseSystem, BaseUser, Main
public interface ChatEntity
extends Commandable

This interface represents any chat object that has an a name and a verbose description. Most objects that clients of this package deal with in fact implement ChatEntity.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Method Detail

addListener

public void addListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Add a listener for this entity. The listener will get any events that it defines interfaces for. ChatEntity itself only ever sends EntityEvents, but subclasses of it may send other classes of event. The listener in general doesn't get pre-sent any EntityEvents, but, again, subclasses may define events that get initially sent upon adding.

ChatEntity objects are also the source for ErrorEvents. Adding an ErrorListener to a ChatEntity should cause that listener to be told when the user needs to be told any error arising from that entity.

Specified by:
addListener in interface Commandable
Parameters:
listener - the listener to add
See Also:
EntityEvent, EntityListener, ErrorEvent, ErrorListener

removeListener

public void removeListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Remove a listener from this entity that was previously added with addListener.

Specified by:
removeListener in interface Commandable
Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

addUberListener

public void addUberListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Add a listener that listens to everything in this entity and in all the entities rooted (directly or indirectly) this one. It only gets told of events that it defines interfaces for. It is treated as if it has been added to each appropriate entity, so, if a sub-entity generally sends events immediately upon addition, then that will happen with this method as well.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add

removeUberListener

public void removeUberListener(java.util.EventListener listener)
Remove a listener that was previously added with addUberListener.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Get the short descriptive name of this object. It should be suitable for human consumption and should generally not change very often. If it does change, a nameChanged event is sent out to announce the fact.

Returns:
the name of the object

getCanonicalName

public java.lang.String getCanonicalName()
Get the canonical form of the name of this object. For example, if this entity is identified by something that ignores case, then the name might be returned in all lower-case. Additionally, the return value is always an interned string. If the canonical name ever changes, a nameChanged event is sent out to announce the fact.

Returns:
the canonical name of the object

getDescription

public java.lang.String getDescription()
Get a verbose string description of this object. It need not be stable.

Returns:
the verbose string description

getCommands

public Command[] getCommands()
Get the user commands that may be used with this entity. There are no predefined commands for ChatEntity objects in general, but all the standard sub-interfaces define standard commands.

Specified by:
getCommands in interface Commandable
Returns:
the array of commands
